top_categories.workout_context: 75ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
At Santa Fe Century Gravelón, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Santa Fe Century Gravelón. Train it until it feels boring.
Santa Fe Century Gravelón's New Mexico mountains, Mountain gravel forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 100 miles.
At mile 60 of 100, glycogen is gone. This workout teaches your body to produce watts on fumes.
7,500ft of climbing on grades that change every minute. You need to switch from seated to standing without losing rhythm.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Santa Fe Century Gravelón's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before May.
Every hard session works better with a bigger aerobic base. At 100 miles, base fitness is the difference between racing and surviving.
7,500ft of climbing means repeated surges above threshold. VO2max work is how you survive the fifth climb, not just the first.
Low-cadence force work for 7,500ft of climbing. The slow, grinding ascents where you can't spin—you push.
Two threshold sessions per week without the recovery cost of VO2max work. For 100 miles, sustainable FTP gains matter more than peak power.
100 miles rewards fat oxidation. This volume work shifts your fuel mix so you're still burning fat at hour 5, not bonking at hour 3.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for Santa Fe Century Gravelón’s 100 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.altitude: Moderate altitude at Santa Fe Century Gravelón. Arrive 2–3 days early. Reduce intensity expectations by 5–10%. Hydrate aggressively.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Santa Fe Century Gravelón requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on new mexico mountains gravel to build confidence. Expect: new mexico mountains, mountain gravel, high altitude.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on TT Threshold, Over Under, and G Spot to prepare you for 100 miles of new mexico mountains gravel in Santa Fe, NM.
